item.description:
Surely nerds pine fondly for the times when intellectual snobs were all the rage around academia!

Topics might be: the applied philosophy of the couch potato, (based on GB Shaw!); does Evolution theory imply that humans are the most advanced monkey? Isn't time travel not just possible, but already happening, since we go forth second-by-second? What ash-cloud disruption? Should humans be flying in the first place? And other FUN provocative ideas.

YOU DON'T NEED TO BE AN INTELLECTUAL TO COME. Just bring your opinions or questions about matters of truth & consequence, and be willing to listen to others. ("Of consequence" here, would not include, say, whether Brittney Spears' magazine photos should be airbrushed or not).
AND: YOU ARE WELCOME TO FAKE IT! a lot of people, including in academia, are really good at this, you just need to bring along an aloof attitude full of irony ...for recommendations I recommend ehow.com, "how to become a pseudo intellectual". "FAKE MOUSTACHES WELCOME".

WE MEET AT THE LEGAL SEAFOOD PATIO in front of the Charles Hotel in Harvard Sq.; in case of sun, there are open umbrellas directed skyward. There is also a bar. Large-size round-table seating is usually not hard to accomplish, and there isn't the pressure to order food; but if you want to order appetizer platters the menu is really reasonably priced. The menu is light fare Raw Bar style, not a full restaurant.
If it is raining we meet just inside the Charles Hotel at the Noir bar & go from there.
For those who arrive early please graciously try to help reserve some table space for later arrivals.

Street parking in Cambridge on Sundays is "unrestricted". Parking is also available at the Charles Hotel garage, ask Legal Seafood to validate your parking ticket for a partial discount.

Harvard Sq. is easily T-accessible via the Red Line subway.

If you have further ideas, please post them. Wall "discussions" for this Meetup are encouraged!
